description: Reverted again. Please. For the love of god. Use. The. Most. Up. To. Date. Version. Combine the two versions so you don't make it worse when you update it. PLEASE.

title: Black Sabbath

description:
" Removed the clean track. If you listen closely, you can tell that the guitar during the verses is still overdriven. I believe both it and the opening riff are on the exact same track and there weren't any overdubs or anything."
Please read the previous changes before making changes. I feel like it's better to have them both in the same track, even if it doesn't necessarily sound right, because, if not, it may lead people to believe that the two parts were recorded separately, when they were not. How Iommi distorted his tone on the original allowed him to just turn his guitar volume down for less distortion, from what I can tell.
title: Black Sabbath

description: In the verse it sounds not as distorted
title: Black Sabbath

description:
- Renamed tracks
- Change instrument of vocal track
- Edited/moved section markers
- Removed the clean track. If you listen closely, you can tell that the guitar during the verses is still overdriven. I believe both it and the opening riff are on the exact same track and there weren't any overdubs or anything.
- Removed everything from measures 70-107 from the overdub (now named rhythm) guitar track. The bass seems to be slightly overdriven in that section, but it's definitely not guitar.
- Corrected what the drum track does at measures 65-71
- Corrected tempo changes near the bridge section
- Added a tempo change at 108
- Removed the major third (fourth fret G string) and the D (third fret B string) from the chords from measure 108 to the end of the song. I couldn't hear those notes at all in those sections, and it doesn't make a lot of sense for a G major to be in this song, as it's in G minor.
- Added chord symbols for the end
title: Black Sabbath
